meanings.definition: A mechanical device that transmits power from an engine to the wheels of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The gearboxes in the car help it move forward.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the gearboxes in the truck.
meanings.sent3: The gearboxes decided to take a break from spinning all day.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like intricate gearboxes, always in motion.
meanings.sent5: The shiny gearboxes gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The system of gears in a machine that controls the speed and direction of movement.
meanings.sent1: The gearboxes of the clock ticked rhythmically.
meanings.sent2: He studied the intricate gearboxes of the old engine.
meanings.sent3: The gearboxes at the factory never seemed to stop chattering.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down, as if caught in the gearboxes of fate.
meanings.sent5: The gearboxes hummed softly, orchestrating the machine's movements.

meanings.definition: The collection of gears in a transmission that allows for different speeds and torque.
meanings.sent1: The gearboxes of the bike clicked as he changed gears.
meanings.sent2: She carefully lubricated the gearboxes of the motorbike.
meanings.sent3: The gearboxes at the party were always shifting and changing.
meanings.sent4: His words meshed together like the gearboxes of a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The gearboxes whirred with precision, smoothly transferring power.
